entry.title: [ImprovedDownloadWarnings] Add "Turn on Safe Browsing" link
entry.content:
This adds a link in the download bubble security dialog offering to

open the settings page so the user can turn on Safe Browsing. This link

is displayed when the user has no Safe Browsing protections but is

able to turn it on. The link goes to the chrome://settings/security page

and also displays the IPH for Enhanced Safe Browsing.



The link also goes along with special warning text on the security

dialog and button/status text calling the file "unverified".



Screenshots/screencast:

https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/1EhurZBXUEUUARnn8RPj13KwnHKKuVAbC



Bug: 1465966

entry.title: [iOS] image saver can be stopped
entry.content:
Image saver starts a coordinator. It thus should be able to stop it

if its owner is stopped. This CL ensures that stops is propagated

from the context menu to the image saver’s alert coordinator.

entry.title: [iOS] Add arguments to SafeBrowsingUrlCheckerImpl's constructor
entry.content:
This adds hash-prefix real-time lookup-related arguments to

SafeBrowsingUrlCheckerImpl's iOS-specific constructor. These arguments

are already present in the non-iOS-specific constructor.



A future CL will pass in non-default values of these arguments as

part of implementing hash-prefix real-time lookups on iOS.

entry.title: Address comments on code guidelines.
entry.content:
Make setForcedColorsAndDarkPreferredColorScheme emulate forced colors.



The function Internals::setForcedColorsAndDarkPreferredColorScheme is

used in the web tests based on dynamic-color-scheme-change.html



This function sets forced colors from the renderer process on the web

theme engine and the current native theme, but doesn't create any

color providers to be used by the web theme engine.

This CL extracts the creation of the emulated forced colors color

provider in WebThemeEngineDefault into it's own function, and calls

the new function to create the color providers to be used when

rendering fluent scrollbars.



Bug: 1467299

Change-Id: Ib72560afaa430aede818ab5331ba6fc9541425b2

entry.title: [iOS] stop alert coordinators
entry.content:
According to ChromeCoordinator invariant, all coordinators should be

stopped before being deallocated. This CL ensures that whatever the user chose, the coordinator is stopped; whether they tap a button or

dismiss by tapping outside (which call the cancel button)



Bug: 1466233

Change-Id: I8d12d72e7a292a9c83906e52662a3c27290e877a

entry.title: geolocation: Request macOS location permission
entry.content:
This CL enables Chrome to request the macOS system level

location permission.



Previously, if the user granted the site-level location

permission through the normal permission bubble, a second

bubble would be shown indicating that access is still

blocked by a system level permission and providing a button

to modify system permissions.



With this CL, Chrome requests the system level permission

instead of showing the second bubble.

entry.title: [iOS] actionSheetCoordinator stopped
entry.content:
According to ChromeCoordinator invariant, all coordinators should be

stopped before being deallocated. This CL ensures that whatever the user chose, the coordinator is stopped; whether they tap a button or

dismiss by tapping outside (which call the cancel button)



In ActionSheetCoordinator, a cancel item is always added.

So adding this cancel element is not adding a new item, it’s only

ensuring it stops the coordinator



Bug: 1466233

entry.title: Exclude scrollbar autoscroll animation from ongoing_scroll_animation
entry.content:
ongoing_scroll_animation is used to determine when

WidgetInputHandler::WaitForInputProcessed should run its callback: it

won't be run until ongoing_scroll_animation is false. The only caller

of WaitForInputProcessed is SyntheticGestureController, which uses it

when triggering a sequence of gesture events, to ensure that each

event is fully processed before the next event is sent.



Prior to this patch, if a synthetic pointer down event falls on a

scrollbar button, then WaitForInputProcessed would not invoke its

callback until the resulting scroll animation finished, i.e., when the

beginning or end of the scroll node's content was reached. This

happens because the pointer down event initiates a scroll animation

(called an "autoscroll" animation) that continues until either a pointer

up event is received, or the end of the scrolling region is reached.



In practice, that's not the desired behavior -- it's actually impossible

to synthetically click a scrollbar button once to scroll by a single

increment, because the pointer up event will be blocked until the

autoscroll animation ends by other means (i.e, the end is reached).

crbug.com/1447868 explains why this hasn't caused more problems.



With this change, WaitForInputProcessed will only wait until

there is no running non-autoscroll animation; it will ignore the

state of autoscroll animations.



Bug: chromium:1447868



Change-Id: I0daca3618784e2a054722725e5d60bcc958a3497

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4709525

Reviewed-by: Steve Kobes

Commit-Queue: Stefan Zager

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1179944}

entry.title: Reduce number of touch_action_rects and wheel_event_rects in HitTestData
entry.content:
For complex contents with special touch action or wheel event handler,

all descendants record hit test data with their rects. Now check if a

new hit test rect is contained by the previous one to reduce

unnecessary rects. This will lower the cost to map each rect to layer

space [1] and add the mapped rect into SkRegion [2] when updating the

regions in cc layers.



This will prevent performance regression when we record hit test data

in NGTextFragmentPainter::Paint() for crbug.com/1453975.



[1] 0.06% [2] 0.13% in SSM: https://uma.googleplex.com/p/chrome/callstacks?sid=07a116140493f9b297cfa6c1d88ae65c



Bug: 1453975

entry.title: [omnibox][chrome://omnibox] Improve 'click to expand' trigger.
entry.content:
In chrome://omnibox, clicking on suggestion rows expands their height to

make their contents more readable. This doesn't happen when the user is

trying to select text from the page (e.g. to copy), since it would mess

up the selection.



Currently, the logic to avoid expansion when selecting text checks if

the mouse moved between the mouse-down and mouse-up events. This has a

lot of false positives, because the mouse often moves a pixel or 2 when

clicking. So the user often has to click multiple times before the row

expands, which is annoying.



This CL changes the logic: it avoids expansion when there is actual text

selected.



This isn't foolproof either: unselecting text by clicking inside the

previous selection will send the 'click' event before selection is

cleared, causing the logic to not realize the selection is being removed

and the height expansion to not occur. But it seems much better than the

existing trigger.



Change-Id: I7c72f97114a87b129f4a2c8d57c7256526614f65

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4749605

Auto-Submit: manuk hovanesian

Reviewed-by: Angela Yoeurng

Commit-Queue: Angela Yoeurng

entry.title: [omnibox][ml] Add feature param to increase provider limits to 10.
entry.content:
This CL adds a feature param to override the max matches by provider

limit when ML scoring is enabled. It also adds a feature variant

that sets the URL providers (HQP, HUP, Bookmark, shortcut, and fuzzy

history) max matches to 10.



This allows us to pass more suggestions to be re-scored by the model,

increasing the likelihood of making an impact without making as big of

a performance regression as re-scoring all possible candidates

(unlimited suggestions). The IncreaseNumCandidates param/variant is

also re-named to UnlimitedNumCandidates.



Bug: 1405555

entry.title: Use template engine for GN output
entry.content:
Previously, gnrt contained code to output GN syntax. While this worked

OK, it necessitated a rebuild of gnrt to tweak many aspects of its

output, and the code was very repetitve.



In principle a template engine is a perfect fit: we have a list of GN

rules and associated data, and most of the work is simply making that

syntactically correct. A BUILD.gn file template is more intuitive to

edit and reduces the number of hard-coded constants in gnrt's Rust

sources. This also gives Chromium embedders more freedom to tweak

build file output without carrying patches against gnrt.



Now that gnrt is built as a standalone cargo package rather than a GN

target, we have more freedom in pulling in dependencies, so using a

template engine is an option now.



This enables future improvements, including merging third-party and

stdlib code paths.



Change-Id: I9008a31e4161ff3a6147e861c2e42e8580a266d9

entry.title: iwa: Clear Isolated Web App data on uninstallation
entry.content:
Previously IWA shared the same data clearing logic with PWA. This change

uses newly introduced RemoveIsolatedWebAppBrowsingData() to clear IWA

data on uninstallation.



RemoveIsolatedWebAppBrowsingData() must be called before the primary

registry removal because it depends on web app data in the registry.



RemoveIsolatedWebAppBrowsingData() is also called after

|is_uninstalling| is set, which means we need to use

GetAppsIncludingStubs() instead of GetApps() in

ChromeBrowsingDataRemoverDelegate.



Bug: 1449362

entry.content:

optimization is used in practice today, which cases trigger it, and

how often navigations end up not committing after the early swap

(since that latter case implies being left on a just-swapped blank

frame). This will be handy to help evaluate impact of upcoming

changes to the early swap logic.

entry.title: Turn off deny(warnings) in gnrt
entry.content:
This was added to mirror the behavior from the GN build. However, with

no CI build coverage, it's minimally useful, and it's hard to turn off

for local dev. New lints can be added in new rustc versions, so it can

break e.g. tools/rust/gnrt_stdlib.py usage unexpectedly.



If we decide we still want warnings-as-errors, we should do so by

passing a rustc flag in the python wrapper scripts; this makes local

development easier since it can easily be turned off.

entry.title: Add extra UMAs to MoveMigrator.
entry.content:
The patch adds '*.MaxResumeReached' which is recorded when maximum

number of resume for move migration is reached.



The patch also fixes broken UMAs with discrepancies between the UMA

name and the entries in histograms.xml.



Namely these UMAs are:

- MoveMigrator.ResumeCount

- MoveMigrator.PreMigrationCleanUpTimeMS

- MoveMigrator.SetupLacrosDirCopyTargetItemsTimeMS

- MoveMigrator.CancelledMigrationTimeMS

- MoveMigrator.SuccessfulMigrationTimeMS

- MoveMigrator.MoveLacrosItemsTimeMS

entry.title: Make dialog user-agent styles apply while in top layer
entry.content:
This makes it so that while the dialog element is doing an exit

animation, its positioning etc. styles from the user-agent stylesheet

still apply so it doesnt jump to a different spot while animating out.

The :modal class is removed during this time which is why it was a

problem before. We also can't just make all dialog elements always have

these styles applied, because then they would also apply to non-modal

dialogs.



Spec: https://github.com/whatwg/html/pull/9387



Fixed: 1451910

entry.title: Bookmarks++: Fix context menu flicker
entry.content:
Fixes a bug where the contextMenuBookmark_ variable was getting set to

undefined after getting set to the correct bookmark, causing the hover

highlight to disappear and/or flicker. This fix passes a callback into

the calls to show the context menu, to ensure it gets called after the

entry.title: [Graphite] Add feature to disable MSAA when it's detected as being slow
entry.content:
Graphite currently has no internal fallback for MSAA not being

well-supported on Intel Macs. This CL adds a base::Feature and flag

that configure Graphite to use single-sampled aliasing when MSAA is

detected as being slow (which concretely is true on all Intel Macs). We

will use this to explore the user experience on these devices when MSAA

is being used vs. single sampling being used.



Note: To determine whether your device falls into the "MSAA is detected

as slow" category, go to about://gpu and search for `msaa_is_slow`; if

present, then your device would be impacted by turning on this flag.



Bug: 1462127, 1462900

entry.title: Improve facilities around base::expected:
entry.content:
* Add gMock support:

** HasValue(), ValueIs(), and ErrorIs() matchers

** ASSERT_OK_AND_ASSIGN() macro (see ASSIGN_OR_RETURN() below)

** Tests for the above



* More ergonomic use in both prod and test code:

** RETURN_IF_ERROR() and ASSIGN_OR_RETURN() macros

** Tests for the above



expected_macros.h could use a bit more context. These macros are taken

from Google internal code, where they're typically used with

absl::Status[Or]. They make it simpler to write error-handling code that

deals with `expected`, and don't usually overlap with the monadic ops

that type provides.

entry.title: graphite: use an intermediate texture in DCompSurfaceImageBacking
entry.content:
In BeginDrawDawn(), an intermediate texture will be created with

the same format, but textureable and not guarded. So it can be

used by graphite as render target. The EndDrawDawn() will copy

the content of the intermediate texture to the dcomp texture at

the update offset from BeginDraw().

entry.title: Fix several tests that fail with Rust JSON parser.
entry.content:
AggregationServiceNetworkFetcherTest, CastMediaRouteProviderTest,

AccessCodeCastDiscoveryInterfaceTest



With the introduction of the Rust JSON parser, which runs in a

thread pool instead of a service process, the TestURLLoaderFactory's

internal RunUntilIdle calls are not sufficient. In all cases, the

event we are waiting for is handled with a callback, so

`RunUntilQuit` is a better option.



HeaderDirectFromSellerSignalsTest



The Rust JSON parser runs in a thread pool, but

SingleThreadedTaskEnvironment does not provide one.



KAnonymityTrustTokenGetterTest



The previous set of fixes (5169a2543d6006d30a6a58b0f1932ca8b9eb58dd)

missed some intermittents due to an assumption that a pending

request already existed in the TestURLLoaderFactory. The Rust JSON

parser used in parsing responses runs in a threadpool, racing with

the test suite's attempt to get the subsequent pending request This

CL adds a "wait loop" for those requests to appear.



Change-Id: Iaf24a0521965182cf6a46304f9b0af82a1e98953

Bug: 1455145

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4743182

entry.title: Add initial Windows virtual display driver and application code.
entry.content:
This code is derived from the following repository:

https://github.com/microsoft/Windows-driver-samples/tree/main/video/IndirectDisplay/

and imported into //third_party/win_virtual_display



The following changes have been made:

1) IddSampleDriver/ placed in driver/ and renamed to

ChromiumVirtualDisplayDriver.

2) IddSampleApp/main.cpp renamed to

controller/display_driver_controller.cc.

3) Add code to send and read DEVPROPERTY struct from the controller

to the driver.

4) Remove some build configuration from platforms we wont use (x86, arm)

5) Other changes to satisfy chromium coding (presubmit) standards:

a) Header arrangement and spacing.

b) Add chromium/clang compatible windows headers.

c) Removing `using namespace`

d) Adding include guards in headers



This CL is intended to add the basic folder structure and initial

components to work in the chromium source tree.

The bulk of the work will be developed in crrev.com/c/4718145.

entry.title: Add browser tests for Hardware Secure Fallback
entry.content:
Add a browser test that does the following:



- Request media key system for a HW secure CDM

- Create a CDM session and generate request

- Update the CDM session with a key that is hard coded to crash the

session

- Repeat the crash (since the fallback logic gets triggered on

persistent crashes.)

- Observer that request the media key system for HW fails after fallback

is in place.
